attributes.action: Make it illegal to shoot rabbits in the UK.
attributes.background: My rabbit got shot by a farmer whilst it was out in the field whilst i watching him. And it could happen to a lot more people and if you have a pet rabbit it might get shot.

attributes.action: Review the exempted conditions and ages for NHS prescription charges
attributes.background:
The list of exempt conditions and age limits have not been reviewed and inequalities now exist.
1. Some life-long life-threatening conditions make sufferers eligible for free prescriptions even when not related to their condition, others receive no support.
2. The age limit of 60 is out of date.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Some of the biggest killers are not currently covered by exemptions such as heart disease. This can mean that people may miss medication to keep them well.
2. The current system encourages those exempt to visit a Dr to obtain prescriptions for minor illnesses when medication is available over the counter. This costs the NHS time and money.
3. As retirement ages increase and people are working longer it is logical that other benefits should remain aligned to the same age.

attributes.action: Change The General Election Voting System From FPTP To Instant-Runoff Voting
attributes.background: Hello, I am Emmanuel and I am 13 years old and came across a video on YouTube that displayed how bad the first past the post voting system is. In its simplest form FPTP is basically winner takes all. In the general election the Conservatives won 36.9% of the votes but they have 100% of the power.
attributes.additional_details:
I want to change the the the general election voting system from FPTP to IRV because in IRV there is definitely a majority winner so most people who vote will at least be moderately happy.

This YouTube video explains how bad FPTP is: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s7tWHJfhiyo

This YouTube video explains how much better IRV is: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Y3jE3B8HsE

attributes.action: Suspend wage reviews for senior civil servants until after brexit negotiations
attributes.background: Civil servants shouldn't need motivating to do their job of backing British interests but unfortunately they have been so intermingled with the EU for so long. They could be inclined to drag thing's out hoping for a new Pro EU government or a second referendum.
attributes.additional_details: So I suggest halting all senior service pay a promotion reviews until after the brexit process has been completed with a cut off date of 2019 a full year before the next generation election. Then the retrospective senior service reviews will be based on past brexit performance not a half hearted effort of the reluctant

attributes.action: Anti Flash Hoods to be Mandatory Under SOLAS Regs
attributes.background: Ammend SOLAS Regulations to make the issue of Anti Flash Hoods a mandatory requirement as part of ships fire fighting equipment

attributes.action: Ask this Government to consider issuing a medal to all serving armed forces.
attributes.background: I consider anyone serving their country for security and safety reasons should be acknowledged by means of a medal of service for their dedication and support to make this a safer and better World for us all to live and work in as a show of appreciation.

attributes.action: An annual National Sports Day to grow participation in sport & physical activity
attributes.background: One day a year should be designated a National Sports Day (#sportsday). Saturday 27th August 2016 saw the #IAmTeamGB campaign hold free events around the country to encourage people to participate in sport and physical activity. This should become a government supported annual national event.
attributes.additional_details:
In December 2015 Tracey Crouch MP Minister for Sport, Tourism and Heritage launched 'Sporting Future: A New Strategy for an Active Nation', encouraging sport and physical activity as a national priority. Shortly after, Jennie Price Chief Executive, Sport England launched the new 2016-2021 strategy 'Sport England: Towards An Active Nation'.

We need an annual National Sports Day to bring these strategies to life and to capitalise on Team GB & Paralympics GB's potential to inspire the nation.

attributes.action: Introduce a Mandatory 10 year prison sentence for Vehicle theft/ involvement in.
attributes.background: The people of Great Britain are sick of working hard to buy vehicles, only to have them stolen by criminals who do not care. The impact of their crimes affect thousands of people, who suffer untold hardship, financial loss & emotional distress due to crime. The law needs to be a major deterrent.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently the penalty for stealing a vehicle does not fit the crime, many criminals walk free from court with punitive punishments, despite causing huge problems for the victims of their crime.

The law needs to ensure that theft of a vehicle is so harshly punished it will make it unappealing.

attributes.action: Consolidate mobile telephone infrastructure networks under one umbrella company
attributes.background: Many of us consumers choose a mobile provider based on coverage in the areas where we live and work. But when we travel we often find connectivity is poor (or non-existent) in certain areas if we are customers of the wrong provider.
attributes.additional_details: If the network infrastructure were to become owned by one umbrella company, then we could have excellent coverage no matter with which provider we were customers. The providers would then have a similar business relationship with the umbrella company as train operators have with Network Rail, or broadband providers have with BT Openreach. In attracting customers, providers could no longer rely on coverage, but would need to find innovative ways to be competitive.

attributes.action: Create more opportunities to further vocational subject skills in state schools.
attributes.background: In state education here in the U.K our youth have next to no chances to properly further their vocational skills, e.g dance! Many schools not offering a thing in some of these areas that could potentially be the child's gift in life! For many school is the only outlet for them to progress in this.
attributes.additional_details: Focus on sporting and academic departments take away sometimes completely from the vocational or artistic side. If that is a career a youth would want to pursue then it is the EDUCATION systems duty to EDUCATE the students on such matters! But no input or teaching on these skills are taught, hindering the abilities of our youths and holding them back from their potential, MANY, MANY people have a skill in vocational activities and subjects that could lead to a career in it.

attributes.action: Automate all trains so there are no longer drivers or manual door openers.
attributes.background: It is ludicrous in 2016 that huge swathes of the country should be held to ransom by union action over something as silly as who controls the doors - personnel are paid far too much to press a button and move a lever. The technology has existed since the 70s to automate all of this.
attributes.additional_details: In 2016 Train Drivers hold the country to ransom whenever they want a pay bump, or even more favourable conditions. The average transport for London driver earns £55k, in the south, the average is £39k. No part of their job requires a human. It's time for progress, guarantee these people jobs until retirement, hire no new drivers - and slowly automate away the skill gap so that the current drivers don't suffer, but that no drivers can come along to make the rest of the country suffer.

attributes.action: To start the Tax Office and Government standard tax year from the 1st January.
attributes.background: The start date for the Fiscal Year of the 6th April was fixed when the UK moved to the Gregorian Calendar and is based on the antiquated "Quarter Days". Computers and Spreadsheets work best with whole months and years.  It is time that the Government Fiscal year is brought into the 21st century.

attributes.action: Solution to restrict migration, whilst appeasing freedom of movement
attributes.background: All solutions on this issue will not please everyone, so neutral ground must be found. This I believe is a good solution to restrict the number of incoming EU nationals while maintaining freedom of movement to those who genuinely want to live & work in the UK, which in turn allows free trade with EU
attributes.additional_details:
•	All EU arrivals to the UK must complete 24 months of paid contributions to the state before receiving free NHS care 
•	Prior to completing the 24 months, all those who do not qualify for free state medical care must have a private European style health insurance policy
•	All foreign nationals wishing to transfer money overseas must pay a government stamp duty or tax
•	EU nationals claiming benefits, a maximum of 20% of income into the account is allowed to be transferred outside of the UK

attributes.action: Make politics more inclusive for people with disabilities.
attributes.background:
I want to make politics and  careers  in local and central government more easier and accessible for people with disabilities and learning difficulties.
I would like to see more people with disabilities involved in policy making and government positions.

attributes.action: Make prisons rehabilitation centres to lower crime caused by released inmates.
attributes.background:
People who are put into prison are being released and causeing eaither the same crime or a worse one. 
Other countries have resorted to this tactic of instead of keeping inmates locked in like animals they give the a working environment where they can become better working citizens.

attributes.action: Prevent motorway central reservation grass cutting
attributes.background: The cost in time and lost commerce is immense and so un-necessary, it's naturally sown wild grasses and flowers (and helps prevent glare at night from headlamps on the opposite carriageway). Three times this week I have been delayed by these works totalling 3 hours in delays.

attributes.action: send an allied task force to eliminate ISIS
attributes.background: ISIS must be destroyed before they can kill more innocent civilians.

attributes.action: Stop banks charging,for IN THE RED on pensioners & those on low incomes,
attributes.background: Fed up on this action, continually in the red simply because of these £32 deductions!
attributes.additional_details: Now we are enforced to get paid by the Banks, this did not happen when we were paid by the Post Office, with our Pension Books

attributes.action: Stop media from publicising the nationality of criminals to prevent prejudice
attributes.background: If a nationality is associated with a horrible act of violence in the media, it is easy for readers to then associate people of that nationality with acts of terror and violence. This can make innocent people of that nationality very prone to racism and prejudice.

attributes.action: Amend the planning rules away from favouring development
attributes.background: Developers seemingly put forward a massive plan for development and consult only a few neighbouring roads, plus put up a couple of laminated notices. Local councils can put out local plan consultations with no publicity. They should both be required to inform a far larger section of local population
attributes.additional_details: Planning rules seem to favour rich developers against local objections. This should be sorted so that development plans can no longer be released with minimal publicity and fanfare, and then developers or Local councils who want massive development to occur claim that minimal protest counts as approval for their plans

attributes.action: Add Black English to the national census
attributes.background: In England and Wales, non-white ethnic groups, as such, are not offered the standard option of including ‘English’ as part of their ethnic group: they’re officially classified only as ‘Black British’, ‘Asian British’, etc., and not ‘Black English’ or ‘Asian English’.
attributes.additional_details: By contrast, black and Asian persons living in Scotland are permitted to identify as ‘Black Scottish’ and ‘Asian Scottish’.English people" are both a nation and an ethnic group, having white skin is not a requirement.

attributes.action: Introduce a "safe for the road" certification system for both riders and horses.
attributes.background: Horses are large animals and potentially dangerous on the roads, especially  to pedestrians and cyclists. The level of rider skill, and the temperament of the animals is enormously varied. Most horse riders are able and considerate but a significant minority are not.

attributes.action: Establish extradition treaties so British victims of crime are supported.
attributes.background: I want to raise the issue of the safety of British Nationals and their families overseas and develop on the international extradition treaties and assistance that is in place.
attributes.additional_details: If you or a member of your family has been subjected to a crime a suspected criminal can flee to another country or back to the UK that has no treaty in place and will not face any criminal proceedings.

attributes.action: Ban the use of black plastic in single use packaging.
attributes.background: Many councils do not accept black plastic in recycling schemes because it is very difficult to recycle, and can contaminate the recycling process. We suggest that the use of black plastic in single use packaging is banned.

attributes.action: Allow people who need IVF to have babies to have 2 live births through the NHS.
attributes.background: At the moment you can only have one live baby through the NHS with their IVF scheme. This is a petition to allow people who need IVF treatment to have at least two live babies with NHS funding. Both tries should allow two fresh and two frozen cycles.
attributes.additional_details: Currently you are only allowed two fresh and two frozen tries to conceive a baby. If you fall pregnant on these tries you are no longer allowed to have NHS funding for future babies. On average private IVF treatment costs around £8,000 for one attempt. Although it is fantastic to have one child most parents want their children to have a sibling and this should be on the NHS with funding from them too.

attributes.action: Road improvements to dual carriageway between Polegate to Lewis
attributes.background: With the increased housing developments in and around Eastbourne and Polegate causing more traffic congestion along the A27 between Polegate to Lewis it's now time to dual carriageway this section of road

attributes.action: Hold a 2nd referendum which includes 2 million EU Nationals living in Britain.
attributes.background:
Did the EU referendum breach the
CHARTER OF FUNDAMENTAL RIGHTS OF THE EU
CH V: CITIZENS' RIGHTS Article 41
Right to good administration
2.     This right includes:
the right of every person to be heard, before any individual measure which would affect him or her adversely is taken;
attributes.additional_details:
The EU Referendum precluded over 2 million EU Nationals living in Britain from voting, the outcome of which will affect them adversely.
If we leave the EU it is likely EU Nationals will stay in Britain and will then have the right to vote in all elections, with a possibility of a coalition government with the SNP and Liberal Democrats calling for a referendum.
The vote to leave the EU has sent shock waves throughout Europe we have a chance to influence the EU and re-unite Europe.

attributes.action: Block the affiliation fee increase of 1150% for rifle clubs and museums
attributes.background:
The home office is running a review of affiliation fees for rifle clubs and museums holding section 5 firearms.
The fee is currently £84, under the new proposal the fee would increase to £1050; an increase of 1150%.
This would have a massive impact on the 38 museums and 61 clubs requiring this.
attributes.additional_details:
The government have made it an arduous process to respond, requiring a lengthy form to be downloaded, filled, and emailed back. This is likely to significantly reduce the amount of signatories opposed to this proposition.
The official review is here: https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/583035/170110pn_Firearms_Fees_consultation_FINAL.pdf

attributes.action: Stop Cuts To Mental Health
attributes.background: Mental Health is a illness which can not be taken away it will always be part of the person it effects, it's not like breaking a leg and it will health this is something that will never heal.  Theresa May talks about a country that works for everyone why not mentally ill people
attributes.additional_details: If cuts are made to Mental Health then place where people can go to talk about this may have to close then there would be nothing left for them. Just the opportunity to talk to someone it can make a big difference, but if this was taken away who would they talk to some people have no family and are all alone. People take their own lives or self harm because there is no help for them. How would you feel if someone you cared about did this!?

attributes.action: be able to self-exclude from book makers and casinos for more then a year
attributes.background: I know from experience and self banning use to be five years now it's only one year and that's not enough we should at least have a right to choose how long we can ban ourselves for.

attributes.action:
1.Importance of voters age of 50 years and above.
2.Allow 16 years old to vote.
attributes.background: I used to study in UK  .As a foreigner it felt so good that something which British citizens (locals) were voting and i as a foreigner was also voting.That showed me the importance,responsibility and equity in that very moment about voting.
attributes.additional_details:
1.Considering double the votes for elections only for those voters above the age of 50 years.As elders know the best to choose and by doing so it will encourage the young generation to vote and also to choose wisely and the best for the nation.
2.Allow 16 years old to vote.There should be proper knowledge provided to the students in schools & colleges about what the votes are and what are the benefits to vote for themselves and for the nation.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for any councillor to fail to pay council tax.
attributes.background: As a lawyer and council tax payer I read of an increasing number of councillors who fail to pay their council tax and this problem cannot be allowed to continue

attributes.action: Change the way that benefits are calculated to take cost of living into account
attributes.background: Benefit claimants living in an area where the cost of living is particularly high are at a disadvantage. Local Housing Allowance takes property prices in the applicant's area into consideration when calculating Housing Benefit entitlement, and I believe benefit rates should be calculated similarly

attributes.action: Right to buy from housing association with full discount make housing accessible
attributes.background:
We have Right to buy which provides you discount if you have lived in council property for over 3 years. 

We can get up to 50% discount of property 

Like if you lived in council property for 15 years you are eligible for 45% Discount 

£150000 * 45 / 100 = 67,500 you pay only £82,500
attributes.additional_details:
https://righttobuy.gov.uk/right-to-buy-calculator/

https://www.gov.uk/right-to-acquire-buying-housing-association-home/overview

We would like the government to provide the same discount for Right to Acquire as Right to Buy. This will help lot of people to get on property ladder and easily accessible especially for younger generation as they are eligible if they have lived in the household. With rise in rent and housing prices this would be best option for lower to middle class to become owners

attributes.action: £1pw contribution to help fund NHS by ALL adults irrespective of age and income
attributes.background: I propose an idea to help fund our beloved NHS and Care Services  before they collapse under the pressure. A compulsory contribution of £1pw from all adults, controversially regardless of age and income. This would raise around 2.6b a year.
attributes.additional_details: I have calculated £2.6b a year by using the simple calculation of approx 50m adults (over 16) in UK x £1 = £50m x 52 wks = £2.600.000.000. 16 would be the starting age if not in education. For this to work I believe everyone needs to contribute. It would be easy to start excluding people because of age and income etc but this would put a greater financial burden on fewer people who would resist the charges. The NHS is freely available to all, so a small weekly contribution of £1 seems fair.

attributes.action: Bring democracy to the workplace
attributes.background: Many of us today take great pride having democracy in politics, but one place we have never tried to implement democracy, the place we spend most of our adult life, is the workplace.
attributes.additional_details:
Therefore, I ask for this petition to include workers in each workplace to have the right to,

form a union

elect and deselect members of management

have a say on wages and hours

have a say on how the workplace is run and how the profits are used

allowed to have a weekly/monthly meeting to discuss and vote on anything the workers feel are necessary for the workplace

attributes.action: The Prime Minister, to chair a COBRA meeting to resolve the NHS crisis
attributes.background:
Unnecessary deaths are occurring because of the crisis engulfing the NHS.

The Prime Minister needs to declare the current crisis an emergency and look at ways of saving lives.

A COBRA meeting should be called and the Prime Minister needs to act now to respond to this current situation.

attributes.action: Reverse the past 5 years of cuts to Social Care Budgets
attributes.background: The NHS is grinding to a halt often due to the lack of social care for patients awaiting discharge from hospital, and from the lack of community care obliging the elderly to attend A&E when they would be better helped at home.  The UK's Social care budget has been cut by 31% over the past 5 years.
attributes.additional_details: Financial Statistics from the UK Directors of Adult Social Services budget survey 2015

attributes.action: Change the Discretionary Payment income cap.
attributes.background: The discriminatory payment income cap is much too low. A disabled family on all appropriate benefits falls much higher in income bracket to the aloud £15,000. This is discrimination against severely disabled families, as these people  successfully applied for community care grants and crisis loans.
attributes.additional_details: I myself have spoken to a member of the staff at the Discretionary Payment office and was refused a grant on the basis that my income was too high. The reason for my income being so high was not because of work or anything of the like, was simply because my daughter is so severely disabled and on high rate DLA that she was also entitled to disability component of child tax credit's. That entitlement to the disability component of child tax credit's is what put my and come over.  Discrimination.

attributes.action: Professionals completing babies checks, to screen mums for PND during 1st year
attributes.background: I am a mum of two children. I suffered PND with my second child. I had been to gp before birth but was told too close to birth to be given medication. I was then left and not checked. 14wks post birth I was in a really dark, scary place. Had it been checked during those 1st weeks id had gotten help

attributes.action: Change nhs policy that baby born before 24 weeks can intervene with life support
attributes.background: Babies born before 24 weeks in an NHS hospital should be given immediate emergency care to try get babies breathing if born not breathing or need the support when first born

attributes.action: Give the police a return deadline when an item has been seized.
attributes.background: Give the police a 2 month deadline from the date of arrest, once they have seized any item for any form of forensic analysis. After 2 months, they MUST give the property back to the suspect (unless the item has evidence on convicting them of a crime).
attributes.additional_details: A while back, I was (falsely) arrested in a case where the police seized my business laptop, after nearly a year and hundreds of phone calls to the police, my laptop was finally returned to me, and the case was dropped, however, my company had to shut down due to all my work being on that laptop, and I lost a very good company and people lost their jobs. This is all because the police could not "fit my job in" due to more important work in front of me, and never once kept me in the loop.

attributes.action: Zero tax for 18-21 year olds in education and part time working
attributes.background: People between the age of 18 and 21 can't afford to pay tax on a part time job and don't have enough time for a full time job while in education.

attributes.action: Build more houses specifically for disabled people who own a blue disabled badge
attributes.background: it will help the disabled people move around their house freely and not rely on other people and in the long run it would be cheaper for all the councils within the UK because they don't have to keep changing the adaptions that's already been done in council houses that need to be updated.

attributes.action: Make driving lessons a part of the education system for 16-18 year olds
attributes.background: making driving a part of the education system could potentially lower the amount of car accidents on the roads involving young people. many people have an accident in their first year of driving, teaching young people about the dangers of driving at a younger age could prevent this.

attributes.action: Introduce 24 hour GP Surgeries throughout the UK to alleviate pressure on A&E
attributes.background: Going back thirty years ago we could call our GP practice and a GP would make a home visit resulting in far fewer unnecessary hospital visits to A&E. Today we have 111 which has increased the number of unnecessary A&E visits. Surely funding the return of night time GP's would be more productive.

attributes.action: Make Laser Eye Surgery available as a free NHS service for all eye conditions.
attributes.background: For those people who where glasses and those who do not, as a 20 year old, I struggle with the prospect of knowing that I will have to see the greatest years and future years of my life behind glass, as I am unable to afford the treatment myself.
attributes.additional_details:
Laser eye surgery is available on the NHS for eye conditions that, without treatment, can lead to loss of vision. However, it’s not available for conditions that can be treated successfully in other ways, such as refractive (focusing) errors. 

The reasons for this are that the effect is life changing for the person receiving the treatment. The current means of correcting refractive errors, glasses, are not for everyone.

attributes.action: Calling on the Government to pay for basic Child Funerals if their age is 0-11.
attributes.background: Losing a child or baby is devastating. Many parents should not have to have the worry of paying for a funeral at this distressing time. Most do not have the funds to do so. We are calling on the Government to fund basic funerals for bereaved parents if the child they lose is between 0 and 11.

attributes.action: Drivers of vehicles found driving without all four lights fully lit to be fined.
attributes.background: A Significant amount of vehicles are seen to be driving during evening and night hours without all four lights operating.This is a serious safety hazard, particularly on unlit roads and highways.
attributes.additional_details:
Driving during the nighttime is statistically more dangerous than by   daytime.
 Far too many lights burn out or dim between MOT tests, causing potential for serious accidents.

I ask the Government to give greater police powers in In this issue including issuing Penalty Notice and Penalty Points. 

I am convinced that these changes will make are roads even safer.

attributes.action: UK Government should provide incentives to foreign startups and small companies.
attributes.background: All foreign companies  contributes  a lot  UK economy, employment by paying taxes and creating jobs.  Government  has to amend Foreign Direct Investment policy to increase investments .This can be interest free loans or  discount in VAT or Taxes.Recognise them as 'MAKE IN UK' companies.
attributes.additional_details: Due to Brexit effect all foreign companies  are in big ambiguity whether to stay in UK or NOT.Especially startup companies,budding  entrepreneurs and small scale companies are mostly effected.Fear of upcoming changes in trading law  may discourage  their plans and ventures in UK. It’s going to effect largely to the future UK economy and the growth. UK Government should encourage them.
